eventupdate
Class EventUpdate

java.lang.Object
  eventupdate.EventUpdate

public class EventUpdate
extends java.lang.Object

The EventUpdate class is used to update files in a MySQL database. Files can be tagged with event strings if they match certain date criteria.

Constructor Detail

EventUpdate

public EventUpdate(java.lang.String Host,
                   java.lang.String Db,
                   java.lang.String User,
                   java.lang.String Pass,
                   java.lang.String filePath)
Connects to the database and determines if the connection was successful.

Parameters:
Host - the address of the MySQL host database
Db - the name of the database to use
User - the username to be used in the connection
Pass - the password for the user
filePath - The location of the logFile to write error messages
Method Detail

getFiles

public java.util.ArrayList getFiles(double dataset_id)
Gets all of the files and their properties from a specific dataset. The attributes that are selected are filename,dataset_id,begin_date,end_date,event,purpose

Parameters:
dataset_id - the dataset from which to retrieve the files
Returns:
an ArrayList containing all of the files

updateProjectbyEvent

public int updateProjectbyEvent(java.util.ArrayList<Event> events,
                                int project_id)
Updates the begin date and the end date of each file if it matches an event If the file matches an event the file will be updated to have the begin and end date of this event Checks every file for the specified project.

Parameters:
events - the ArrayList containing the events that will be checked
project_id - the number of the project to be checked
Returns:
the number of files that were updated
See Also:
Event

updateDatasetbyEvent

public int updateDatasetbyEvent(java.util.ArrayList<Event> events,
                                double dataset_id)
Updates the begin date and the end date of each file if it matches an event If the file matches an event the file will be updated to have the begin and end date of this event

Parameters:
events - the ArrayList containing the events that will be checked
dataset_id - the number of the dataset to be updated
Returns:
the number of files that were updated
See Also:
Event

tagDatasetbyDate

public int tagDatasetbyDate(java.util.ArrayList<Event> events,
                            double dataset_id)
Tags files within a certain dataset with an event string if they fall within the BEGIN and END dates Multiple events can be checked.

Parameters:
events - the ArrayList containing the events that will be checked
dataset_id - the number of the dataset to be tagged
Returns:
the number of files that were tagged
See Also:
Event

tagProjectbyDate

public int tagProjectbyDate(java.util.ArrayList<Event> events,
                            int project_id)
Tags every dataset in a project with an event string if they match the date criteria. Every file in each dataset will be analyzed.

Parameters:
events - the ArrayList containing the events that will be checked
project_id - the id of the project to be tagged.
Returns:
the number of files that were tagged
See Also:
Event

getDatasets

public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap> getDatasets(int project_id)
Gets all of the datasets for the specified project id

Parameters:
project_id - the id of the project
Returns:
a HashMap of all of the datasets that match this project id

writeToFile

public void writeToFile(java.lang.String message,
                        java.lang.String filename)
Appends a String to the specified file. Writes the message followed by a "\n" character

Parameters:
message - the String to be appended to the file
filename - the String location of the file

print

public void print(java.lang.String message)
Displays a message to the standard output as well as to a log file. The file is named logFile and will be appended.

Parameters:
message - the String to be displayed and recorded.

loadEvents

public java.util.ArrayList<Event> loadEvents(java.lang.String filePath)
Extracts event information from a file The file should be in the format: Event Start_Date End_Date. where the start and end dates are in the form yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss One event should be specified per line. ex: Wilma 2005-10-16 00:00:00 2005-10-25 23:59:59

Parameters:
filePath - the location of the file to be read
Returns:
an ArrayList containing all of the events

userCommit

public boolean userCommit(int numUpdates)
Asks the user if they would like to commit the changes

Parameters:
numUpdates - the number of changes to display to the user
Returns:
true if the user decided to commit the changes otherwise false

loadFile

public java.lang.String loadFile(java.lang.String filepath)
Reads each line from the specified file.

Parameters:
filepath - the location and name of the file
Returns:
a String containing the results with lines separated by \n characters

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Performs the event update. The event file is used to specify the events and the begin and end dates of each event

Parameters:
args - input arguments. The order of input is: Host Database User Password Project_id Event_File
